page.title: 17Rural living (cont'd)
page.content: rented quite cheaply are now renovated and put on the market at high prices. This together with the expense of travelling to and from their form of work means only those with a high income can afford to live in the country.This means the village is more and more becoming the residence of professional people and not of the farm worker and the tradesman. There is less interest in the church these days particularly amongst young people and though financial support for this is good,the time residents are willing to give to the running of activities.This is less than it used to be.Attitudes to country pursuits like field sports is varied but in general the view against them is hardening with a new generation of village dwellers.
